noun.description: A round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind.
The leathery-leaved evergreen tree that bears the orange, native to warm regions of South and Southeast Asia. Oranges are a major commercial crop in many warm regions of the world.
A bright reddish-yellow color like that of the skin of a ripe orange.

examples: there was an orange glow in the sky

proper noun.description: A town in southern France, on the Rhône River, home of the ancestors of the Dutch royal house.
A city in southwestern California, southeast of Los Angeles in an agricultural area; population 136,392 (est. 2008).

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French orenge (in the phrase pomme d'orenge), based on Arabic nāranj, from Persian nārang.
